Title: Course and exercise sequencing using metadata in adaptive hypermedia learning systems
Supported Tasks Commentary: Create assessment exercises automatically based on user needs
User Model:
Demands and preferences of the
learner
Domain Model: LOM ontology with relations between objects
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Ontology relatiosn are used to generated exercises
Commentary on target metric: Learner satisfaction with the quality of generated exercises is measured through their similarity of generated exercises to human made exercises
Commentary on Evaluation Method: Qualitative questionnaire

Title: A pedagogical framework to integrate learning style into intelligent tutoring systems
Supported Tasks Commentary: When the learner makes a mistake
User Model: Concept being studied, understanding level of the concept and prerequisites, learning style, previous feedback history.
Domain Model: Information objects including the concept it relates to, object type and category, compatibility with other components.
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Maps between infromation objects and learner based on a set of attributes and relatiosn between them.
Commentary on target metric:
Assess the learner's knowledge level for each concept, find reasons for student errors.
Absense of errors is interpreted as knowledge of concepts
Commentary on LOs: Concepts of programming students need to master
Commentary on assessment: By comparing user actions to the expected program written by the instructor

Title: Recommendations in Online Discussion Forums for E-Learning Systems
Supported Tasks Commentary: Resources are discussion threads within an e-learning forum
User Model: User Ratings and Posting behaviour
Domain Model: Discussion forum posts split into threads and weeks in accordance with the university course.
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Precision and Recall
Classic split into test and training data

Title: Tractable POMDP representations for intelligent tutoring systems
Supported Tasks Commentary: Select interventions and appropriate pedagogical actions such as corrections and hints.
User Model: Knowledge states and cognitive states
Domain Model: Set of actions with probabilities to affect states, set of observations with probabilities to indicate states.
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Partially Observable Markov Decision Process (POMDP) method
Commentary on target metric:
The learning is measured through the number of knowledge gaps,
A gap is a knowledge state that is believed to be lacking for the learner.
Commentary on LOs: Knowledge states represent the learning outcomes
Commentary on assessment: It bases it on observations coming from assessment events.
Commentary Dataset: Instructions are provided on how to replicate.

Title: A Semantic Recommender System for Adaptive Learning
Supported Tasks Commentary: Based on identified missing competencies
User Model:
Possessed LOs based on CV
Required LOs based on Job Offer
Commentary on Privacy: No privacy considerations, data taken from resumes.
Domain Model:
1. Taxonomy or ontology of domain concepts
2. Link information to concepts in taxonomy.
3. Calculate semantic distance between concepts.
Commentary on Recommendation Method:
1. Identify comptency gap between possessed and required LOs (compare CV to job description).
2. Querry semantic catalogue of resources
- Compare the words in gap and content
- Support tagging through LOs
- Consider language requirements
Commentary on target metric: Relevance of the recommended courses to the indentified knowledge gaps
Commentary on LOs: Indentied Gaps in Professional Competencies in relation to Job Vacancy
Commentary on Evaluation Method: Correlation Coefficient - between system results against manual ratings given by human trainers

Title: A Fuzzy Tree Matching-Based Personalized E-Learning Recommender System
Comment on Educational Context:
Seems like it can be any e-learning system
The case study resembles university or MOOC courses
Supported Tasks Commentary: Learning activities based on preferences and goals
User Model: A fuzzy tree data-structure including preferred categories, learning goals, and history of learnt activities. Categories and goals are chosen from a predefined list and prioritites are assigned by the learner.
Domain Model: Learning activities are modelled using a fuzzy tree data-structure including the categories each activity belongs to with corresponding weights, also prerequisites and precedence relations between activities.
Commentary on Recommendation Method: A knowledge-based selection of activities is assigned ratings based on both semantic and collaborative similarities between the learner and activites.
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating
Commentary on LOs: Career-based, then maps them to activities based on historic data
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Mean Absolute Error
Classic split into training and test set for MovieLens dataset

Title: Creating Usage Context-Based Object Similarities to Boost Recommender Systems in Technology Enhanced Learning
Supported Tasks Commentary: By determining similarities between learning objects based on their coappearance with other objects within one learning session
User Model: Activities log
Domain Model: Cooccurence vector
Commentary on Recommendation Method: The method of calculating the similarities between objects is novel.
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating
Commentary on Evaluation Method: RSME, F1

Title: Recommender System and Web 2.0 Tools to Enhance a Blended Learning Model
Supported Tasks:
Recommend educational resources
Recommend collaborators
Provide personalized feedback
Supported Tasks Commentary:
Resources are activities and tools
Collaborator are other learners
Feedback is learning advice
User Model: Personal data, digital trace within the course (preferences, learning style, knowledge level, activity level).
Domain Model: Learning modules with activities classified into six categories
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Or even an expert system, but not much description
Commentary on target metric: Academic Performance based on Course Points for Various Activities
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Formal Assessment
Control and Experiment Groups

Title: Educational Game and Intelligent Tutoring System: A Classroom Study and Comparative Design Analysis
Supported Tasks:
Recommend educational resources
Provide personalized feedback
Supported Tasks Commentary:
Adaptively select the next exercise to work on
Feedback and hints to learner
User Model:
Learner knowledge state in terms of probabilites.
Probabilities are calculated from assessment results.
Learner actions within each problem.
Domain Model:
Assessment activities are tied to the knowledge states.
Possible actions within problems are described as strategies (patterns).
Commentary on Recommendation Method:
Uses Bayesian Knowledge Tracing for selecting problems for learners.
Recognizes strategy variations from learner actions, and provides relevant feedback and hints.
Commentary on target metric:
Assessment through Pre and Post Test
Satisfaction is enjoyment
Self-evaluation is students confidence in their learning gains
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
The ITS system was compared to DragonBox game.
Formal Assessment: the performance is the test grade
Control and Experiment Groups
Qualititative Questionnaire: two likert-scale surveys

Title: Implementing an adaptive tutorial system for coding literacy
Supported Tasks Commentary: Adaptively generate the problem using relevant content
User Model:
Log of user's answers (correct and incorrect).
Learning score for each skill.
Domain Model: Generic task templates connected to six basic programming language features
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Uses Category-Based Intrinsic Motivation (CBIM) algorithm
Commentary on target metric: Assess the learner's learning score for each skill by applying logistic function to answers history.
Commentary on LOs: Coding literacy in the form of six basic programming language features
Commentary on assessment:
Log the correctness of each part of the answer.
Each part of the exercise is linked to a skill.
Assess the master by applying logistic function to answers history.

Title: BROAD-RSI – educational recommender system using social networks interactions and linked data
Supported Tasks Commentary: Collaborators are other people based on social profile data
User Model: Semantic ontology-based personal profile including context and learning interests generated from the user's facebook data
Commentary on Privacy: No privacy considerations. Uses facebook data.
Domain Model: Resources represented as a learning objects (IEEE LOM) from several sources including open university, DBpedia, youtube.
Commentary on target metric:
Relevance based on user rating
Used GQM
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Qualitative questionnaire: Subjective questionnaire data on relevance of extracted interest and recommended items. 
Several Proof-of-Concepts with subjective feedback from participants to validate each stage of the solution, and a case study using the experience.

Title: User-Centric Evaluation of Recommender Systems in Social Learning Platforms: Accuracy is Just the Tip of the Iceberg
Supported Tasks Commentary: Recommend resources and communities to teachers through an LMS combined with social media
User Model: Implicitly collected logs: viewing, bookmarking, downloading a resource or joining a community
Domain Model: Learning resources, communities, groups, and discussion posts
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Enhanced CF which authors call Graph-based. The study compares various CF techniques, such as User-based kNN, Matrix factorization with their graph-based algorithm.
Commentary on target metric: They compare accuracy against user-centric subjective metrics
Commentary on Evaluation Method: Qualitative questionnaire
Commentary on assessment: But they measure perception by asking about the effects of learning (how useful)

Title: Knowledge Based Recommender System for Academia Using Machine Learning: A Case Study on Higher Education Landscape of Pakistan
Supported Tasks Commentary: Automate course allocation and research supervisor assignment by  anaylzing CVs and profiles of academic sfaff
User Model: Probabalistic topic model generated from a NL Querry (research proposal)
Domain Model: Probabalistic topic model generated from a NL Querry (resume and google scholar account)
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Measure distance/divergence between probability distributions (topic models)
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating
Commentary on LOs: Though it could in theory, if the research proposal required stating the learning outcomes
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Normalised discounted cumulative gain performance
Measured using training/test datasets

Title: Large-scale e-learning recommender system based on Spark and Hadoop
Supported Tasks Commentary: Courses according to the learner’s behaviors and preferences.
User Model: Student model and their course enrollments
Domain Model: Course model
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Association rules
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating
Commentary on Evaluation Method: No evaluation: they only compared the time performance of various algorithms

Title: An intelligent fuzzy rule-based e-learning recommendation system for dynamic user interests
Supported Tasks Commentary: E-learning resources distributed over 20 topics
User Model: Accessed topics in a particular periods of time (windows), profficiency and involvement levels for each topic.
Domain Model: E-learning topics
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating
Commentary on Evaluation Method: Harmonic mean

Title: A Machine Learning-Based Recommender System for Improving Students Learning Experiences
Supported Tasks Commentary: Course improvement actions to instructors
User Model: No user model
Domain Model: Course characteristics, Assessment results, Course Outcomes
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Classification algorithms
Commentary on target metric: Performance is measured through final exams, midterm exams, assignments, projects and lab exams.
Commentary on Evaluation Method: ML: Hamming Loss, F1
Commentary on assessment:
Though it is trained on historic data passing and failing.
Since it's classic ML, it suggests actions based on historic data of performance, but the current batches performance is not take into account.

Title: Creating a Recommender System to Support Higher Education Students in the Subject Enrollment Decision
Supported Tasks Commentary: Recommendations are based on predicting learner performance (pass/fail)
User Model: Subject pass attempts
Commentary on Privacy: Explicitly stated that no personal data is collected
Domain Model: subjects, prerequisites, pass rate and a few other features
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Classification using various algorithms, and prepocessing
Commentary on target metric: Performace is graduation rate based on pass and fail in the course.
Commentary on Evaluation Method: ML: F1, Predict students’ performance to prevent dropout.

Title: Design and Evaluation of a Deep Learning Recommendation Based Augmented Reality System for Teaching Programming and Computational Thinking
Supported Tasks:
Recommend educational resources
Provide personalized feedback
Supported Tasks Commentary:
Resources are exercises
Feedback is the code hints to students of a programming course
User Model: Activities log including login and logout time, learning material read by student, time of reading, time of learning mission, the steps of student solving mission.
Domain Model: Leaerning materials and missions (tasks)
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Deep Learning
Commentary on target metric: Academic Performance is measured through Test Grade.
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Course Assessment
Qualitative Questionnaire: computational thinking with a Likert scale answers, and mostly measured the confidence and self-effifacy of students.

Title: Recommender Systems and Scratch: An Integrated Approach for Enhancing Computer Programming Learning
Supported Tasks Commentary: Programming tasks to students that are appropriate to their level
User Model: Set of solved exercises, with a ratings tuple (taste, complexity) for each solved exercise.
Domain Model: Profiles of all other users (sets of completed ex, with tuples), based on which three types of similarity between users are computed. Then a set of similar users is produced.
Commentary on Recommendation Method: both user and item based
Commentary on target metric:
Performance: Test Grades
Qualitative: RS performance, User-centric effects, Effects of learning
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Course assessment: test grades
Split into control and experiment groups
Qualitative questionnaire
Commentary on assessment:
Formal university assessment (pre-test/post-test and final grade)
A questionnaire asking about effects of learning.

Title: Reinforcement Learning Based on Contextual Bandits for Personalized Online Learning Recommendation Systems
Comment on Educational Context:
Seems like it can be any e-learning system as long as there is log data of activities.
From the indirect clues we could get that it is talking about WEB-based learning
Supported Tasks Commentary: Web-based resources
User Model: Log of clicked items
Domain Model:
Log of all past student behaviours
Correlation matrix between actions based on the logs
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Reinforcement Learning (Contexual bandits)
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating, in this case it's click through rate (CTR)
Commentary on Evaluation Method: Benchmarking against other algorithms

Title: EduRecomSys: An Educational Resource Recommender System Based on Collaborative Filtering and Emotion Detection
User Model: Set of raiting functions R: User x Resource x Emotion → Ratings (exlicit, 5 stars).
Domain Model: Profiles of all other users (sets of completed ex, with tuples), based on which three types of similarity between users are computed. Then a set of similar users is produced.
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Plus emotion detections
Commentary on target metric:
Relevance based on user rating
User-centric (qualitative) metrics include Perceived recommendation quality (PRQ), their choice satisfaction (CS), their perceived system effectiveness (PSE) and their intention to use (ITU).
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
F1 is for rating.
Qualitative questionnaire
Commentary on assessment:
Though it is trained on historic data passing and failing. 
So it makes predictions based on previous history of outcomes in as much as passing means their mastery.

Title: Ontology-based E-learning Content Recommender System for Addressing the Pure Cold-start Problem
Supported Tasks Commentary: They tried to see what percentage of relevant items can they get using only ontology in a pure cold start setting.
User Model:
Interactions log. 
Personal information: learning styles and background knowledge,
Domain Model: IEEE LOM (ID, title, format, difficulty, type, etc)
Commentary on Recommendation Method: (Ontology), could be called hybrid as users are put into groups based on similarity like in CF, however, not based on ratings.
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating (1-5 scale)
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Qualitative questionnaire
They compare ontology vs clustering.

Title: An efficient e-learning recommendation system for user preferences using hybrid optimization algorithm
Supported Tasks Commentary: Web-based resources
User Model: Interactions log.
Domain Model: Web resources (no detail provided on how they are represented)
Commentary on Recommendation Method: RNN classification of learners and Improved Whale Optimization for predicting the ratings
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
They used a sort of likert scale for learners to rate the items
Accuracy, Recall, Harmonic Mean

Title: A Recommender System Method for Children’s Education Using Mobile Technology
Supported Tasks Commentary: Resources are recommended to children through parents
User Model:
Personal data: necessary and optional.
Vectors indicating contact with other children: communication, learning, teaching.
Based on vectors a status is assigned in each category.
Commentary on Privacy: No privacy considerations, deals with children.
Domain Model: DAG with subject sections assigned to children
Commentary on target metric: The learning is indirectly calculated from the dissemination of information.
Commentary on LOs: Concepts children are required to master, such as math operators or animal kingdom.
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Simulation of the traditional and proposed methods, and comparison between them on how fast the dissemination of correct information will happen.
Then evaluation on children using both methods in sequence.
Commentary on assessment: Indirect assessment: they put a threshold on how many activations (engagements with other learners) should a learner have, and then calculate the probability that the concept is mastered.

Title: ERSDO: E-learning Recommender System based on Dynamic Ontology
Supported Tasks Commentary: Courses are recommended based on pattern mining and collaborative filtering
User Model: Learner Ontology: personal data (full name, gender, contact information, username, password...) and education data such as study level, field of study, languages preferences, and learning style.
Domain Model:
Resource Ontology (course type, course name, course domain, course ID...)
Learner-Course Relation Ontology (different combinations between courses and learners features based on log file)
Commentary on Recommendation Method: knowledge-based and collaborative filtering
Commentary on target metric: Relevance based on user rating
Commentary on Evaluation Method: Precision, Recall, F1

Title: Heterogeneous Evolution Network Embedding with Temporal Extension for Intelligent Tutoring Systems
Comment on Educational Context:
Seems like it can be any e-learning system as long as the items, learners, and interactions can are modeled as a graph.
Intelligent Tutoring System
Supported Tasks Commentary:
It models resources and learners as a heterogenous graph and then uses graph operations to:
Predict learner performance on various exercises (edge weigh prediction).
Annotate knowledge for resources (edge existence prediction)
User Model: Evolving Graph of learner interactions with exercises and resourse
Domain Model: Heterogenous Graph of Exercises, Resourses, Knowledge Concepts
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Deep Learning for Graphs
Commentary on target metric: Accurately Predict Performance or in fact anything else that can be modeled as edge and edge weights (in this case it's pass and fail for assessment exercises).
Commentary on LOs: The knowledge concepts that need to be covered.
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
Performance predictions: Operating characteristic curve (AUC) and prediction accuracy (ACC)
Knowledge annotation: Recall (REC), precision (PRE), and F1
Commentary on assessment:
Though it is trained on historic data passing and failing. 
But it logs exercise performance as a weighed edge between learner and exercise. In turn, exercises are linked to knowledge concepts.

Title: Adaptive Learning Support System Based on Automatic Recommendation of Personalized Review Materials
Supported Tasks Commentary: Review materials and extra reading
User Model:
Quiz results
Activities log including read material, understanding ratings. browsing time
Domain Model:
Lecture slides and quiz questions converted to vectors. 
Learner ratings (understadning), extra materials.
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Word2Vector and cosine similarity
Commentary on target metric:
The rate of change between pre and post test
Usefulness of the recommended material
Commentary on Evaluation Method:
A pre and post test on the subject
Split into control and experiment groups
Qualitative Questionnaire

Title: Requirements Elicitation Based on Psycho-Pedagogical Theatre for Context-Sensitive Affective Educational Recommender Systems
Supported Tasks Commentary: Various forms of pedagogical context-sensitive affective support such as learning interface, contents, assistance relevant to the learner and his context
User Model: Context rich learner model including personality, learning style, personal data, and learning scenario including affective dimension (mood)
Commentary on Privacy: No privacy considerations. Personal data is collected through a workshop and an anonymous survey.
Domain Model: Can be any pedagogical support in the form of a learning interface, contents, assistance.
Commentary on Recommendation Method: Uses an ontology and a specific similarity function
Commentary on target metric: They want relevant cases, i.e. similiar to the learner's querry - what the learner is experiencing to provide relevant pedagogical advice. They compare it against expert rating.
Commentary on Evaluation Method: Accuracy and Fall out
